text: today we hear a lot about the politics
of fear fear terrorism attacks against
the West that's nothing new the only
thing we have weird though we often
think of fear is something toxic
something dangerous it's to be avoided
or repressed and it's true irrational
fear most notably the fear of terrorist
attacks can have very damaging
consequences by being so afraid of
terrorist atrocities we tend to
overstate the danger that they pose to
our societies and therefore we behave
irrationally from allowing fear to
constrain the way we travel and live too
imposing draconian security measures and
surveillance to spending trillions on
military adventures meant to make us
feel more secure but the truth is in the
West the chances have been killed by
terrorists attack very very small indeed
in reality people are much more likely
to be killed by heart disease
complications resulting from obesity or
just everyday domestic accidents meaning
it would be much more rational to invest
more heavily in say medical research
than an endless security infrastructure
we need to ensure that fear is not
simply a tool used by those who want to
incite irrational hatreds and prejudices
we need to reclaim the politics of fear
